title: TimeliNUS
programme: 2021 Orbital - NUS Independent Software Development Project
shortDescription: A project management platform, built using VueJS. Web and mobile interfaces are designed with Figma.
description: In 2021, I became part of Orbital, a NUS Computing summer project, where I engaged at the Artemis level, the highest level of participation. During this program, I successfully developed TimeliNUS, my very own project management platform, utilizing the VueJS framework. Additionally, I skillfully crafted the interfaces for both the web and mobile applications of the platform, employing Figma as my design tool.

title: Langeration
shortDescription: A language-learning proof-of-concept done in 24 hours using React Native and Figma to promote diversity and the concept of inclusive community.
description: In LifeHack 2021, organized by NUS Computing Club, our team earned the 2nd runner-up position for delivering exceptional code quality and thoughtfully designed user interfaces. My winning solution, called 'Langeration', fosters cross-cultural connections between elderly and youth from various countries through language exchange. By enabling both parties to learn each other's native languages, Langeration promotes diversity and the idea of an inclusive community. Here are the prototype interfaces showcasing this innovative concept, crafted using Sketch.

title: Goodbye My E-Waste
shortDescription: Introduced a creative solution to recycle E-waste with a combination of technological innovation, including data analytics and mobile application.
description: As the leader of team GME (Green Metropolis Enthusiast), I effectively guided our group to victory in the international UAiTED Innovation Competition, organized by UAiTED. Our winning proposal tackled the recycling of E-waste through a creative blend of technological innovations, incorporating data analytics and a mobile app to address the UN's SDGs (Goal 9 and Goal 11). During the competition, I conducted a Monte Carlo Simulation to showcase the benefits of employing data analytics in reducing transportation costs and expanding our user market. Below, you can see the interfaces of the mobile application prototype that I skillfully designed using Figma.

title: SciKick
shortDescription: A proof-of-concept that monitors mental health, while providing professional tips and relevant articles for better management.
description: In MindfulHack 2021, organized by MindfulHack, our team's exceptional code quality and thoughtfully designed user interfaces secured us a place among the top 10 teams. Our innovative solution, SciKick, is a comprehensive mental health monitoring application that offers various features and activities, such as journal writing, mentor chats, mood and sleep tracking, enabling users to stay on top of their mental well-being. SciKick also provides valuable professional tips and suggests relevant articles to assist users in effectively managing their mental health. Below, you can view the prototype interfaces meticulously crafted using Figma, showcasing the concept and functionality of our application.

title: artCounting
shortDescription: A desktop application which leverages cloud technology to streamline auditing processes with automation.
description: As one of the participating team for the 2021 Accounting Innovation Challenge, our team proposed artCounting, a Desktop application that will facilitate companyâ€™s auditing process in a more automated way. With artCounting, auditing become less tedious, more efficient, and less human error will be occurred. The application is built using ReactJS, Python, and AWS. You may see some of the interfaces that are built using Figma in the below.

title: OurAI
programme: NUS Social Impact Catalyst - Project Our Food Chapter
shortDescription: An intuitive web-app delivering poster auto-generation feature for owners in Food & Beverages (F&B) sector using VueJS
description: As the software developer for 'Our Food Chapter', I created an intuitive web application that automates poster generation for Food & Beverages (F&B) sector owners, offering support in social media management and digital marketing. The following Figma prototype interfaces showcase this concept.

title: ShipPass
programme: Maritime Singapore Connect Maritime Digital Challenge
shortDescription: A prototype building data entry function with intuitive UI/UX designs and validation to ensure data integrity for sustainable shipping.
description: Chosen as one of the top three finalists out of 20 pre-selected teams in the MSC MariTime Digital Innovation Challenge, our goal was to develop a prototype addressing the problem of generating clean data for sustainable shipping insights. The result was 'ShipPass', our innovative solution offering an intuitive UI/UX design and data validation for seafarers to enter relevant onboard data, ensuring data cleanliness and integrity. Additionally, ShipPass includes data visualization dashboards tailored for decision-makers, data analysts, and other stakeholders, providing a comprehensive understanding of ship performance. Below, you can explore the Figma prototype interfaces that bring this idea to life.

title: Cathay Lifestyle 2.0
shortDescription: A mobile application that reimagines Cathay Pacific's existing application with new interfaces and features.
description: During the Cathay Pacific Hackathon in 2021, our team presented Cathay Lifestyle 2.0, a reimagined version of the existing Cathay Lifestyle application. This revamped app boasts brand-new interfaces and additional features. Cathay Lifestyle 2.0 offers a diverse range of practical and sophisticated products, seamlessly integrating into customers' daily lives, utilizing Asia Miles as currency, and effectively addressing issues like Asia Miles Misconception. The application is developed using React Native. Below, you can explore some of the interfaces designed using Figma to showcase the app's new look and functionalities.

title: INSPIRE
programme: Credit Suisse INSPIRE Women in Technology Mentorship
shortDescription: An interactive web app connecting female role models with users for inspirational mentorship, with integrated Python-based ML model for Medium article recommendations.
description: As a mentee in the 2022 Credit Suisse Inspire Mentorship program, I developed an interactive web application using ReactJS and TypeScript, serving as a networking and socializing platform that connects female role models with users, offering inspirational mentorship under the guidance of two full-time technology analysts from Credit Suisse. Furthermore, I successfully developed a Python-based machine learning model for Medium article recommendations, effortlessly integrating it with the application using FastAPI. You can explore some of the interfaces built using Figma below.

title: Listing Feature
shortDescription: Collaborated with 3 team members from different countries to create a new listing function for the Japanese company Mercari.
description: Under the mentorship of Mercari's engineers, I collaborated with three team members from Hong Kong, Taiwan, and Japan to participate in a Hackathon. Together, we developed a new listing function for Mercari, skillfully utilizing ReactJS, TypeScript, Python, and Docker. Additionally, I designed the website interface using Figma, and to ensure efficient code management and version control, I established a dedicated GitHub repository for the project. You can explore some of the interfaces built using Figma below.

title: LinkOS
shortDescription: A mobile app for the Automated Market/Mall concept, to serve tenants and customers with convenience and quality services.
description: During my internship at LINK REIT, I took part in an internal case competition where our team presented LinkOS, a mobile application that forms a key component of the Automated Market / Mall concept. LinkOS aims to enhance convenience and provide quality services to both tenants and customers. The application was developed using Figma prototyping, and you can explore some of LinkOS's interfaces below.

title: Swirvis
shortDescription: A chatbot-based prototype that enhances the guest experience through personalized recommendations and improved communication, bringing innovative ideas to life and digitally transform the hospitality industry.
description: At the Swire Hotels Hackathon, our team secured the 4th position with Swirvis, a successful solution that digitally transforms the hospitality industry by employing a chatbot to enhance guest experiences through personalized recommendations and improved communication with the hotel. The mobile prototype and wireframe, created using Figma, bring innovative ideas to life. Explore some of Swirvis's interfaces below.

title: PathToCharity
shortDescription: A web application addressing challenges in online charitable donations, streamlining the process for legitimate charities and donors, and ensuring transparency.
description: PathToCharity is a cutting-edge web-application proposed by our BT3103 coursework group at NUS to tackle challenges in online charitable donations, especially amid the Covid-19 pandemic and rising online scams. By offering a user-friendly platform, legitimate charities can create and promote campaigns, while donors can easily find and contribute to causes they care about, streamlining the donation process and ensuring transparency and trustworthiness. The application is developed using VueJS, JavaScript, and Google Firebase, with Figma utilized for interface design, which you can explore below.
